alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Mesa (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 29 at 9:10AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 800 AM THURSDAY UNTIL 900 AM FRIDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...southern Garfield and northern Mesa Counties. Locations include, but are not limited to, Parachute and De Beque. WHEN...800 AM Thursday June 29 to 900 AM Friday June 30 IMPACTS...Dry and windy conditions are expected to continue on Thursday and may once again intensify behavior of the Spring Creek wildfire. On Thursday afternoon and evening, smoke will mainly be transported to areas east and northeast of the fire with brief periods of moderate to heavy smoke possible in Rulison, Rifle, Antlers and Silt. However, heavier smoke will be possible late Thursday night through early Friday morning as the smoke drains to lower elevations. The heaviest smoke impacts early Friday morning will be most likely along the Interstate 70 corridor between Parachute and De Beque. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
